title.native: 聖闘士星矢 邪神エリス

description:
Eris is the goddess of chaos and uses the body of Elien, who is a friend of Hyoga, to revive herself. She obtains the golden apple to drain Athena's life energy to make her ressurection complete and to be able to turn the world in a place filled with chaos. But to be able to attack Eris, Seiya and his friends will first have to defeat the Ghost Knights.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Saint Seiya: The Battle with Eris
Saint Seiya: The Legend of the Golden Apple
I Cavalieri dello Zodiaco - La dea della discordia
Los Caballeros del Zodíaco y la reencarnación de Ellis, diosa de la guerra
Os Cavaleiros do Zodíaco: O Santo Guerreiro

tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

alternative: アンドロメダ星座の瞬

node.description: With the band Make-Up, he recorded several songs for the anime Saint Seiya, including the first opening song Pegasus Fantasy and the first ending song Blue Forever.

Araki developed an interest for drawing at age five. He graduated in Aichi Prefecture. In 1955, at age eighteen, he debuted as a cartoonist in the "Machi" magazine. He then joined Mushi Production as animator in 1964 and later founded Studio Jaccard in 1966. In 1970, he debuted as animation director on [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2402/), and later worked on the anime adaptations of several of [Gou Nagai](https://anilist.co/staff/97992/)'s manga, including [Devilman](https://anilist.co/anime/2252/), [Cutie Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/1661/), and [UFO Robo Grendizer](https://anilist.co/anime/1985/), serving as a character designer on the latter two. In 1971 he founded Studio Z together with his friends in the business.

He frequently worked with animator [Michi Himeno](https://anilist.co/staff/113357/), who he met in 1973. Araki formed Araki Production in 1974 and Himeno was the first member of the studio.

Araki was also an animator on several American productions which outsourced animation work to Japan, including Mighty Orbots (1984, key animation), The Adventures of the American Rabbit (1986) and G.I. Joe: The Movie (1987).

He passed away due to heart failure on December 1, 2011.

Seiji Yokoyama was a prolific Japanese incidental music composer from Hiroshima who was best known for his work on the Space Pirate Captain Harlock and Saint Seiya series. He was a graduate student of Kunitachi College of Music.

He made his debut as a composer for the ending theme of The Adventures of Hutch the Honeybee in 1971. He was known for his symphonic sound for many television programs.

On July 8, 2017, Seiji Yokoyama died from pneumonia.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Birthplace:__ Rome, Lazio, Italy

Younger sister of [Anna Rita Pasanisi](https://anilist.co/staff/174948)

[Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/gilbertobaroli/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/gilberto_baroli/) | [Facebook 1](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.9) | [Facebook 2](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli) | [Facebook 3](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.5) | [Facebook 4](https://www.facebook.com/gilberto.baroli.7)

Gilberto Pereira Baroli is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, and translator. He is married to [Rosa Maria Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/180909/), father of [Hermes Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/100069/), [Luciana Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/106520/) and Hiram Baroli, stepfather of [Letícia Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/100136/) and grandfather of [Bruna Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/274698/), [Caio Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/262448/), Hiram Baroli Filho and [Gustavo Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/341902/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Papa Smurf (The Smurfs 1981 [1st dub], Les Schtroumpfs 2021, The Smurfs and the Magic Flute [2nd dub], My Smurfy Valentine, Smurfily Ever After [2nd dub], The Smurfs Christmas Special [2nd dub] and The Smurfs The Legend of Smurfy Hollow)
- Aurelion Sol, The Star Forger (League of Legends)
- Yoninin Dokussai (2nd voice - eps 17-50; Sekai Ninja Sen Jiraiya)
- Elementor (Max Steel franchise)
- Richard Harrison (Pawn Stars)
- Commander Yui Ibuki (Dengeki Sentai Changeman)
- Park Rick Marshall (1st dub; The Land of The Lost)
- Commander Sanjuurou Sugata (Hikari Sentai Maskman)
- Rampage / Protoform X (Beast Wars)
- Comissioner Francis "Frank" Reagan (2nd voice - 13th season onwards; Blue Bloods)
- Sr. Bullet (Mullet Mad Jack)
- Three-Eyed Raven (2nd voice - 6th season; Game of Thrones)
- Fulgor (Masters of the Universe: Revolution)
- Donkey Xote (Remigio Globus)
- Hades (Impérios AD)
- General Themes (Don't Look Up)
!~

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/sergiomorenoator/)

Sérgio Moreno is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and vocalist. He became especially well-known for starring in the musical "Jasmim ou o Sonho do Cinema", a series by Filipe La Féria for SIC. He trained at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in London. He owns the studio Sérgio Moreno Filmes.

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/hermesbaroli/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hermesbaroli) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/hermesbaroli)

Hermes Pereira Baroli, better known only as Hermes Baroli, is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, entrepreneur, screenwriter, television presenter and art director. He is also the son of actors and voice actors [Gilberto Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/102351/) and [Zodja Pereira](https://anilist.co/staff/202529/), brother of actresses and voice actresses [Letícia Quinto](https://anilist.co/staff/100136/) and half-brother of [Luciana Baroli](https://anilist.co/staff/106520/), married to [Leticia Grassi](https://anilist.co/staff/205030/). One of his most remarkable works was the voice of the character Seiya of Pegasus in The Knights of the Zodiac. He also voiced Matt Damon in Saving Private Ryan, Manabu in Sekai Ninja Sen Jiraiya, Edward Norton in Fight Club, James Franco in 127 Hours and Scott Summers / Cyclops (1st voice) in X-Men: Evolution.
Chiaki Imada was an animation producer. He died of pneumonia at the age of 82.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/森下孝三)

The managing director of [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/窪田忠雄)

The second representative director of Mukuo Studio.
